Privacy Policy
Donation Requests
Lion Country Safari is pleased to support the work of many charitable organizations each year through Lion Country Safari ticket donations. Due to the overwhelming number of requests, we receive, we ask you that prior to submitting a request, you review our request policies/criteria below to see if your organization may qualify.
Our standard donation is two tickets to the park valued at $118.00.
Donation request must be submitted
three months prior to the event.
No phone requests please.
Priority will be given to organizations in Palm Beach County that focus on conservation and animals or children and education.
Organizations are eligible for a donation one time per 12-month period.
Non-profit tax Id/Consumer’s Certificate of Exemption is required.
Lion Country Safari will be considered as a sponsor or contributor on all printed materials.
If your organization meets the above criteria, please submit your request at the link below.
Donation Request Form
If your request is approved, your organization will receive one pair of one-day admission tickets to Lion Country Safari approximately 3 weeks prior to the event. Due to the high volume of donation requests received, we are unable to check the status of any individual donation request.
Truly,
Lion Country Safari, Inc. – Florida
Contact us at Lion Country Safari
Address
2003 Lion Country Safari Road, Loxahatchee, FL 33470
Phone Number
(561) 793-1084
E-mail

Bring the whole herd out and make a group reservation!
ALL GROUPS MUST SUBMIT A RESERVATION REQUEST AT LEAST
ONE WEEK BEFORE
THEIR RESERVATION DATE (WITH THE EXCEPTION OF FAMILY GROUPS) TO RECEIVE THE DISCOUNTED RATE.
Only credit cards, organizational checks, debit cards, and mobile payments are accepted.
All group reservations have a MINIMUM number of paid guests (guests ages 3 and over) and must pay with ONE form of payment.
Prices are subject to change without notice.
Group Rates are not valid with any other offers or special events.
We DO NOT offer rain checks or refunds for groups or take personal checks.
Please note that tax-exempt groups are required to provide their Consumer Certificate of Exemption (DR-14) to remove taxes.
Please contact the Groups Coordinator for any additional questions.
Group Sales
P:
(561) 793-1084 ext. 2270
E:
groups@lioncountrysafari.com
School Groups
For school, youth groups, camp groups, daycares, homeschools ONLY, 1 adult chaperone will receive complimentary admission for every 10 paid student. For the safety of our guests and animals, chaperones must remain with their group and supervise children during the entire visit.
Additional chaperones are charged at the discounted adult rate.
According to our policy, in order to receive a comped chaperone, the chaperone must be considered an adult that is hired to take care of students/children that are not their own.
What qualifies as a school group? Accredited public, private or charter schools, and licensed day-cares.
Please note that tax-exempt groups include schools, churches, and non-profit organizations with a valid exemption status. We must receive your Consumer’s Certificate of Tax Exemption with your reservation form to receive tax-exempt pricing.
A minimum of 15 paid guests is required.
September – May
Monday-Sunday: $13.00 per student and $17.00 per adult for admission only.
Prices are subject to change without notice. Group rates are not valid with any other offers.
Programs
and labs are available as an upgrade during the months of September-May.
Programs and labs are available on weekdays only; start times are available between 9:30AM and 10:30AM.
Educational programs are free for schools and non-profit groups that have a minimum of 50 paying participating students (ages 3 and over). *A $125.00 deposit is required to hold your program booking and will be credited towards your admission on the day of your visit.
Educational programs are $125.00 for groups with less than 50 paying students (students ages 3 and over).
Hands-On STEM labs are $150.00 for any school or non-profit group. Labs have a maximum of 50 students per session.
Programs and labs are subject  to availability and are provided on a first-registered, first-served basis. All programs and labs require a (3) week notice and must be paid in full at the time of booking.
Click here
for a list of offered school programs.
Make a Reservation
June – August
Monday-Friday: $14.50 per student and $18.50 per adult for admission only.
$4.00 plus tax per person for the Water Park Upgrade.
Water Park upgrade includes 1-hour of access to the changing areas, Safari Falls, Splash Pad and Water Slides.
Please note: Groups planning to upgrade to the Water Park MUST reserve in advance. If your group does not select the upgrade in advance, we cannot guarantee admittance to the Water Park on the day of your visit.
Saturday-Sunday: $25.00 per person. Includes admission to both the drive through and walk through safari, access to the water play areas and all rides.
A minimum of 15 paid guests is required.
Make a Reservation
Scout Groups
September – May
Monday-Sunday: $13.00 plus tax per student and $17.00 plus tax per person for admission only.
Scout programs are $125.00.
Scouts BSA Merit Badge programs are $175.00.
Scouts BSA programs are taught by certified merit badge counselors that can sign off on the assignment.
Programs are only available during September-May, require 3 weeks’ notice and are provided on a first-registered, first-served basis. All programs must be paid in full at the time of booking.
Prices are subject to change without notice. Group rates are not valid with any other offers.
A minimum of 15 paid guests is required.
Click here
for a list of offered programs.
Make a Reservation
June – August
Monday-Friday: $14.50 plus tax per student and $18.50 plus tax per adult for admission only.
$4.00 plus tax per person for the Water Park Upgrade.
Water Park upgrade includes 1-hour of access to the changing areas, Safari Falls, Splash Pad and Water Slides.
Please note: Groups planning to upgrade to the Water Park MUST reserve in advance. If your group does not select the upgrade in advance, we cannot guarantee admittance to the Water Park on the day of your visit.
Saturday-Sunday: $25.00 per person. Includes admission to both the drive through and walk through safari, access to the water play areas and all rides.
A minimum of 15 paid guests is required.
Make a Reservation

Unscheduled and Family Groups
15% discount offered at the ticket booths only.
Non-Peak Days (Mon, Tues, Wed): Child- $33.15 Regular- $42.50
Peak Days (Fri, Sat, Sun & holidays/holiday weeks): Child- $37.39 Regular- $46.74
**Please note prices are before tax.
Child tickets are for ages 3-9, Regular tickets are for ages 10 and older.
Special note:
Unscheduled and Family groups that have 20 or more paying guests (guests ages 3 and over) DO NOT need to make a reservation. On the day of your visit, please arrive together with ONE form of payment and let the ticket attendant know you are a family with 20 or more guests.
If you have additional questions, please don't hesitate to contact our Main Office at (561) 793-1084.

Group Visits
Birthday Parties
Events and Private Rentals
Thank you for your interest in hosting a WILD event here on safari!
Lion Country Safari is the perfect location to host your party, family reunion or corporate event! Rent our 4,000 sq/ft outdoor pavilion for groups of 50 guests or more, build a menu from our expansive catering selections and host an event your group will never forget!
For inquiries, please reach out to our Events Coordinator directly at
events@lioncountrysafari.com
.

Lion Country Safari is a Drug-Free Workplace and an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Current Employment Positions
Lion Country Safari accepts employment applications for all departments. Please visit our office during normal business hours (9:00 – 5:00 every day) and fill out an application, or fill out an online application for one of the job openings listed below. After choosing a position, you will have the opportunity to fill out an application online.

About Us
Contact Us
Join Our Team
Privacy Policy
Our Mission
Be a leader in animal care, conservation and education to inspire people through connections with wildlife in a fun, family-friendly environment.
Our Vision
Drive positive connections with people and wildlife in a family-friendly environment.
our story
Lion Country Safari opened in the summer of 1967 in rural Western Palm Beach County with dozens of free-roaming lions and a few other species. The drive-through safari park is believed to be the first cageless zoo in the country, introducing a new concept in zoology and bringing the experience of an African game park - then and now, an expensive and time-consuming trip - to families who would otherwise not be able to experience an African safari.  South Florida’s Western Palm Beach County proved to be an ideal location for the park due to its year-round tropical climate, plentiful land, a growing population and tourists who visit from all over the world.
Lion Country Safari, West Palm Beach is a leader in Palm Beach County’s tourism industry, offering a unique and affordable opportunity to enjoy the largest drive-through safari in Florida. The park is accredited by the Association of Zoos and Aquariums and has also been recognized as one of the top three zoos in America by USA Travel Guide, one of the ten best safari parks by USA Today, and Palm Beach County’s Top Local Attraction. The 320-acre attraction offers the drive-through safari, walk-through adventure park and award-winning KOA campground.
At Lion Country Safari, large herds of animals from 6 continents roam free, while humans visiting are enclosed (in their vehicles). Hundreds of WILD animals including lions, wildebeest, giraffe, the largest herd of zebras on record in North America, ostrich, chimpanzees and rhinos call Lion Country Safari home and roam wide-open, naturalistic habitats.
Lion Country Safari is involved in a number of sustainable efforts to reduce waste and use more ecofriendly products and also participates in many conservation and breeding programs (called Species Survival Plans) for threatened species, including rhinoceros, zebra, oryx, siamangs, and more. These programs help to ensure the survival of a healthy, sustainable population of threatened species in human care and help facilities like Lion Country Safari to act as lifeboats or figurative arks as wild populations decline and face extinction.
